meanings.sent1: After the break, the coach decided to remobilize the team for the final game.
meanings.sent2: The workers were remobilizing the equipment after the maintenance was completed.
meanings.sent3: The toys seemed to be remobilizing themselves every time the child left the room.
meanings.sent4: The town was remobilizing its resources to prepare for the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent5: The students were remobilizing their study materials for the upcoming exams.

meanings.definition: To put back into motion or circulation.
meanings.sent1: The librarian was remobilizing the books on the shelves to make space for new arrivals.
meanings.sent2: The government was remobilizing funds to support the relief efforts in the disaster-stricken area.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved remobilizing the cards in a surprising sequence.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was remobilizing the energy of the crowd with each new performance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was remobilizing the students' attention by introducing a fun activity.
